response.original_title: Die St. Florianer Sängerknaben - Bruckners musikalische Heimat
response.overview: A documentary exploring the time of the most famous St. Florian Boys' Choir member, Anton Bruckner, and comparing his daily life, when there were only three choirboys, with that of the St. Florian Boys' Choir today. A series of reenactments brings Anton Bruckner's training years to life. Under the direction of Gunar Letzbor, precise reconstructions of works from Bruckner's sound world of the 1830s are performed. In contrast, the rehearsals and performances of the current St. Florian Boys' Choir, under the artistic direction of Prof. Franz Farnberger and choirmaster Markus Stumpner, MA, present the choir's sound today.
response.title: Die St. Florianer Sängerknaben - Bruckners musikalische Heimat
